mip.description: DCPP is a suite of decadal hindcast and forecast experiments, and mechanism and case study experiments.
mip.keywords: DCPP, decadal climate prediction, hindcast, mechanisms and case studies
mip.label: DCPP
mip.rationale: The undeniable value to society of reliable information about climate variations on decadal time-scales calls for skilful decadal forecasts informed by hindcast experiments and supporting experiments which identify the responsible physical processes and which improve understanding of forced climate change and internal variability.

dcppA-historical-niff.description: A coordinated set of multi-member ensembles of retrospective forecasts (hindcasts) initialised each year from 1960 to the present (otherwise every second year).  Radiative and other forcing information (e.g. greenhouse gas concentrations, aerosols etc.) maintained at initial state value or projected in a simple way.  No inclusion of volcano or other short term forcing unless available at initial time. Initialise from the historical simulation. Run each member for at least 5 years, preferably 10 years.
dcppA-historical-niff.long_name: hindcasts initialized from historical simulation without observed forcing after initialization
dcppA-historical-niff.rationale: Improved estimates of the effects of initialisation.

dcppC-ipv-minus.description: Restore the Pacific sea surface temperature to negaitive Pacific Decadal Variability (PDV) perturbation. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members. SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-ipv-minus.keywords: DCPP, Tier 1, pacific, restored SST, PDV-, negative Pacific Decadal Variability
dcppC-ipv-minus.rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of negative Pacific Decadal Variability (PDV) anomalies.  To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Atlantic.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppC-hindcast-noElChichon.description: Prediction experiment without volcano forcing. Repeat DCCP-A1 1982 hindcast without El Chichon forcing. Background volcanic aerosol to be the same as that used in the 2015 forecast. 10 ensemble members. Run each member for at least 5 years, preferably 10 years.
dcppC-hindcast-noElChichon.keywords: DCPP, Tier 2, no El Chichon, volcano
dcppC-hindcast-noElChichon.long_name: hindcast but with only background volcanic forcing
dcppC-hindcast-noElChichon.rationale: Volcano effects on decadal prediction. To assess the impact of volcanoes on decadal prediction skill. Investigate the potential effects of volcanic eruption on forecasts of the coming decade. Investigate the sensitivity of volcanic response to the state of the climate system.

ssp245.description: SSP-based RCP scenario with medium radiative forcing by the end of the century.  Following approximately RCP4.5 global forcing pathway with SSP2 socioeconomic conditions. Radiative forcing reaches a level of 4.5 W/m2 in 2100. Concentration-driven.
ssp245.keywords: ScenarioMIP, Tier 1, Scenario, SSP, RCP, SSP2, RCP4.5, future,  Medium forcing, SSP-based RCP
ssp245.long_name: update of RCP4.5 based on SSP2
ssp245.rationale: The scenario represents the medium part of the range of plausible future pathways.

dcppC-amv-plus.description: Restore the north Atlantic sea surface temperature to positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) perturbation. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members.  SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-amv-plus.keywords: DCPP, Tier 1, north Atlantic, restored SST, AMV+, positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability
dcppC-amv-plus.rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomalies.  To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Atlantic.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppC-amv-trop-plus.description: Restore the tropical north Atlantic sea surface temperature to positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) perturbation. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members.  SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-amv-trop-plus.keywords: DCPP, Tier 2, tropical north Atlantic, restored SST, AMV+, positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability
dcppC-amv-trop-plus.long_name: idealised positive tropical AMV anomaly pattern
dcppC-amv-trop-plus.rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomalies.  To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Atlantic.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppC-forecast-addElChichon.description: Prediction experiment for 2015 with volcano forcing.  Repeat DCPP-A1 2015 forecast (from the dcppA-hindcast experiment) with El Chichon forcing. Background volcanic aerosol to be the same as that used in the 1992 hindcast. 10 ensemble members. Run each member for at least 5 years, preferably 10 years.
dcppC-forecast-addElChichon.long_name: 2015 forecast with added El Chichon forcing
dcppC-forecast-addElChichon.rationale: Volcano effects on decadal prediction. To assess the impact of volcanoes on decadal prediction skill. Investigate the potential effects of volcanic eruption on forecasts of the coming decade. Investigate the sensitivity of volcanic response to the state of the climate system.

dcppC-pac-pacemaker.description: Restore to observed anomalies of sea surface temperature in the tropical eastern Pacific. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. Historical values of atmospheric composition/emissions and solar forcing. Time period: 1950-2014 (run from 1920 if possible). 10 ensemble members.  SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-pac-pacemaker.keywords: DCPP, Tier 3, hiatus, tropical eastern Pacific, restored SST
dcppC-pac-pacemaker.rationale: To investigate the role of tropical eastern Pacific sea surface temperatures in the modulation of global surface temperature trends and in driving regional climate variations.  Pacemaker experiment.

dcppC-hindcast-noPinatubo.description: Prediction experiment without volcano forcing. Repeat DCCP-A1 1991 hindcast without Pinatubo forcing. Background volcanic aerosol to be the same as that used in the 2015 forecast. 10 ensemble members. Run each member for at least 5 years, preferably 10 years.
dcppC-hindcast-noPinatubo.long_name: hindcast but with only background volcanic forcing
dcppC-hindcast-noPinatubo.rationale: Volcano effects on decadal prediction. To assess the impact of volcanoes on decadal prediction skill. Investigate the potential effects of volcanic eruption on forecasts of the coming decade. Investigate the sensitivity of volcanic response to the state of the climate system.

dcppC-ipv-plus.description: Restore the Pacific sea surface temperature to positive Pacific Decadal Variability (PDV) perturbation. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members. SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-ipv-plus.keywords: DCPP, Tier 1, pacific, restored SST, PDV+, positive Pacific Decadal Variability
dcppC-ipv-plus.rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of positive Pacific Decadal Variability (PDV) anomalies.  To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Atlantic.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppB-forecast.description: Ensembles of ongoing real-time 5-year forecsasts. Initialisation based on observations. Atmospheric composition and/or emissions (and other conditions including volcanic aerosols) to follow prescribed SSP2-4.5 forcing scenario. Run each member for 5 years, extend the duration to 10 years with Tier-2 priority. Additional ensemble members for each start date are requested with Tier-2 priority.

dcppC-atl-pacemaker.description: Restore 12-month running mean, anomalies of sea surface temperature in the north Atlantic. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. Historical values of atmospheric composition/emissions and solar forcing. Time period: 1950-2014 (run from 1920 if possible). 10 ensemble members (up to 25 members requested).  SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-atl-pacemaker.keywords: DCPP, Tier 3, north Atlantic, restored SST
dcppC-atl-pacemaker.rationale: To investigate the role of north Atlantic sea surface temperatures in the modulation of global surface temperature trends and in driving regional climate variations.  Pacemaker experiment.

dcppC-amv-minus.description: Restore the north Atlantic sea surface temperature to negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) perturbation. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members. SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-amv-minus.keywords: DCPP, Tier 1, north Atlantic, restored SST, AMV-, negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability
dcppC-amv-minus.rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomalies.  To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Atlantic.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppC-amv-extrop-plus.description: Restore the extra-tropical north Atlantic sea surface temperature to positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) perturbation. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members.  SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-amv-extrop-plus.keywords: DCPP, Tier 2, extra-tropical north Atlantic, restored SST, AMV+, positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability
dcppC-amv-extrop-plus.long_name: idealised positive extratropical AMV anomaly pattern
dcppC-amv-extrop-plus.rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomalies.  To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Atlantic.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppC-atl-spg.description: Repeat DCCP-A1 hindcasts with altered initial conditions. Initialise with climatology (1960-2009 average) in the north Atlantic "sub-polar ocean" (95W-30E, 45N-90N).  Linear transition between climatology and actual observations over a 10 deg buffer zone (35N-45N).  10 ensemble members.  Run each member for at least 5 years, preferably 10 years.  Start dates end of 1993, 1994, 1995, 1996.  Additional start dates at end of 1992, 1997, 1998, 1999.
dcppC-atl-spg.keywords: DCPP, Tier 3, hindcasts, forecasts, mid-1990s, yearly start dates
dcppC-atl-spg.long_name: predictability of 1990s warming of Atlantic sub-polar gyre
dcppC-atl-spg.rationale: Case study of mid-1990s Atlantic subpolar gyre warming.  To investigate the predictability of the mid-1990s warming of the subpolar gyre, and its impact on climate variability.

dcppC-amv-trop-minus.description: Restore the tropical north Atlantic sea surface temperature to negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) perturbation. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members. SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-amv-trop-minus.keywords: DCPP, Tier 2, tropical north Atlantic, restored SST, AMV-, negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability
dcppC-amv-trop-minus.long_name: idealised negative tropical AMV anomaly pattern
dcppC-amv-trop-minus.rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomalies.  To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Atlantic.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppC-pac.description: Restore the Pacific sea surface temperature to the model control run climatology.  Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members. SST signal may also be impoased by altering suface fluxes.
dcppC-pac.keywords: DCPP, Tier 1, pacific, restored SST, model climatology
dcppC-pac.rationale: Control experiment for Pacific Decadal Variability (AMV) perturbation experiments. To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Pacific.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppC-amv-extrop-minus.description: Restore the extra-tropical north Atlantic sea surface temperature to negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) perturbation. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members. SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-amv-extrop-minus.keywords: DCPP, Tier 2, extra-tropical north Atlantic, restored SST, AMV-, negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability
dcppC-amv-extrop-minus.long_name: idealised negative extratropical AMV anomaly pattern
dcppC-amv-extrop-minus.rationale: To investigate the climate impacts of negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomalies.  To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Atlantic.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppC-forecast-addAgung.description: Prediction experiment for 2015 with volcano forcing.  Repeat DCPP-A1 2015 forecast (from the dcppA-hindcast experiment) with Agung forcing. Background volcanic aerosol to be the same as that used in the 1963 hindcast. 10 ensemble members. Run each member for at least 5 years, preferably 10 years.
dcppC-forecast-addAgung.rationale: Volcano effects on decadal prediction. To assess the impact of volcanoes on decadal prediction skill. Investigate the potential effects of volcanic eruption on forecasts of the coming decade. Investigate the sensitivity of volcanic response to the state of the climate system.

dcppA-hindcast-niff.description: A coordinated set of multi-member ensembles of retrospective forecasts (hindcasts) initialised each year from 1960 to the present (otherwise every second year). Radiative and other focing information (e.g. greenhouse gas concentrations, aerosols etc.) maintained at initial state value or projected in a simple way.  No inclusion of volcano or other short term forcing unless available at initial time.  Initialise from observations.  Run each member for at least 5 years, preferably 10 years.
dcppA-hindcast-niff.keywords: DCPP, Tier 4, hindcasts, forecasts, 1960, yearly start dates, initial conditions maintained
dcppA-hindcast-niff.long_name: hindcasts initialized from observations without observed forcing after initialization
dcppA-hindcast-niff.rationale: Promotion of the science and practice of decadal prediction. The provision of information potentially useful for the IPCC assessment reports on climate prediction and evolution. To improve estimates of hindcast skill.

piControl.description: A pre-inudsutrial control simulation with non-evolving pre-industrial conditions. Conditions chosen to be representative of the period prior to the onset of large-scale industrialization, with 1850 being the reference year.  The piControl starts after an initial climate spin-up, during which the climate begins to come into balance with the forcing. The recommended minimum length for the piControl is 500 years.
piControl.keywords: CMIP, Tier 1, DECK, Diagnosis Evaluation and Characterization of Klima (Climate), pre-industrial, reference, control, climate,
piControl.rationale: Control experiment against which perturbations are compared, it serves as a baseline for experiments that branch from it.  To allow us to determine unforced model variability.  The control experiment should be long enough to extend to the furthest point in time reached by the end of the perturbation experiments,  thus the control should allow us to subtract any residual, unforced drift from all perturbation simulations.

dcppC-forecast-addPinatubo.description: Prediction experiment for 2015 with volcano forcing.  Repeat DCPP-A1 2015 forecast (from the dcppA-hindcast experiment) with Pinatubo forcing. Background volcanic aerosol to be the same as that used in the 1991 hindcast. 10 ensemble members. Run each member for at least 5 years, preferably 10 years.
dcppC-forecast-addPinatubo.keywords: DCPP, Tier 1, VolMIP, Tier 3, Pinatubo, volcano, eruption, volcanic forcing
dcppC-forecast-addPinatubo.rationale: Volcano effects on decadal prediction. To assess the impact of volcanoes on decadal prediction skill. Investigate the potential effects of volcanic eruption on forecasts of the coming decade. Investigate the sensitivity of volcanic response to the state of the climate system. To address the impact of volcanic forcing on seasonal predictability.  To address the climate implications of a future Pinatubo-like eruption.

dcppC-atl-control.description: Restore the north Atlantic sea surface temperature to the model control run climatology. Outside the restored region the model evolves freely allowing full climate system response. No interannual changes in external forcing. Time period: 10 years. 25 ensemble members. SST signal may also be imposed by altering surface fluxes.
dcppC-atl-control.keywords: DCPP, Tier 1, north Atlantic, restored SST, model climatology
dcppC-atl-control.rationale: Control experiment for Atlantic Multidecada Variability (AMV) perturbation experiments. To discover how models respond to imposed slowly evolving SST anomalies in the Atlantic.  To illuminate model behaviour on decadal time scales and possible mechanistic links to retarded and accelerated global surface temperature variations and regional climate anomalies.

dcppA-hindcast.description: A coordinated set of multi-member ensembles of retrospective forecasts (hindcasts) initialised each year from 1960 to the present (otherwise every second year). Prescribed CMIP6 historical values of atmospheric composition and/or emissions (and other conditions including volcanic aerosols).  Future forcing as the SSP2-4.5 scenario. Run each member for at least 5 years, extend the duration to 10 years with Tier-2 priority.  Additional ensemble members for each start date are requested with Tier-3 priority.
dcppA-hindcast.keywords: DCPP, Tier 1, Tier 2, Tier 3, hindcasts, forecasts, 1960, yearly start dates
dcppA-hindcast.long_name: hindcasts initialized from observations with historical forcing
dcppA-hindcast.rationale: Promotion of the science and practice of decadal prediction. The provision of information potentially useful for the IPCC assessment reports on climate prediction and evolution. To provide hindcast/forecast information.

dcppC-hindcast-noAgung.description: Prediction experiment without volcano forcing. Repeat DCCP-A1 1963 hindcast without Agung forcing. Background volcanic aerosol to be the same as that used in the 2015 forecast. 10 ensemble members. Run each member for at least 5 years, preferably 10 years.
dcppC-hindcast-noAgung.long_name: hindcast but with only background volcanic forcing
dcppC-hindcast-noAgung.rationale: Volcano effects on decadal prediction. To assess the impact of volcanoes on decadal prediction skill. Investigate the potential effects of volcanic eruption on forecasts of the coming decade. Investigate the sensitivity of volcanic response to the state of the climate system.

dcppA-historical.description: Ensemble of historical and near-future climate simulations. Use the same model as used for hindcasts. Initial conditions from a pre-industrial control simulation. Prescribed historical and future forcing as the SSP2-4.5 scenario. Run from 1850-2030. Ten ensemble members.  Additional ensemble members for each start date are requested with Tier-3 priority.
dcppA-historical.keywords: DCPP, Tier 2, Tier 3, historical, near future sceario
dcppA-historical.long_name: simulations initialized from control with forcing prescribed from a portion of the historical period
dcppA-historical.rationale: To quantify the effects of initialisation.

historical.description:
Simulation of recent past (1850 to 2014). 
Impose changing conditions (consistent with observations). Should be initialised from a point early enough in the pre-industrial control run to ensure that the end of all the perturbed runs branching from the end of this historical run end before the end of the control.
historical.long_name: all-forcing simulation of the recent past
historical.rationale: Spans the period of extensive instrumental temperature measurements from 1850 to the present. Evaluate model performance against present climate and observed climate change.

RestoreSSTPDVposPacific.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
RestoreSSTPDVposPacific.description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus positive PDV anomaly by Newtonian cooling over the Pacific (10S-65N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present. Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.
RestoreSSTPDVposPacific.keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, PDV+, positive PDV, positive Pacific Decadal Variability
RestoreSSTPDVposPacific.label: Restore SST PDV pos Pacific

180yrs1840-2029.description: Historical scenario, from pre-industrial to near future
180yrs1840-2029.label: 1850-2029 180yrs

AOGCMconfiguration.description: Use a coupled Atmosphere-Ocean general circulation model
AOGCMconfiguration.label: AOGCM Configuration

HistoricalLandUse.data_link: Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land use forcing data (850-2100)
HistoricalLandUse.description: Apply the global gridded land-use forcing datasets to link historical land-use data and future projections.  This new generation of “land use harmonization” (LUH2) builds upon past work from CMIP5, and includes updated inputs, higher spatial resolution, more detailed land-use transitions, and the addition of important agricultural management layers.
HistoricalLandUse.label: Historical Land Use

HistoricalSolarIrradiance.data_link: SOLARIS-HEPPA Solar Forcing Data for CMIP6
HistoricalSolarIrradiance.description: The standard solar forcing dataset recommended for usage is the solar reference scenario dataset which consists of historical reconstructions (1850-2014).  Includes total solar irradiance, F10.7 cm solar radio flux, and spectral solar irradiance for 10-100000 nm range.
HistoricalSolarIrradiance.keywords: Solar Forcing, Historical, Solar, Spectral Irradiance, SSI, TSI
HistoricalSolarIrradiance.label: Historical Solar Irradiance Forcing

RestoreSSTAMVposNAtlantic.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
RestoreSSTAMVposNAtlantic.description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus positive AMV anomaly by Newtonian cooling over the North Atlantic (10N-65N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present. Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.
RestoreSSTAMVposNAtlantic.keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, AMV+, positive AMV, Positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability
RestoreSSTAMVposNAtlantic.label: Restore SST AMV pos N Atlantic

ImposeSSTclimNAtlantic.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
ImposeSSTclimNAtlantic.description: Alter surface fluxes to impose model control climatology Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) over the North Atlantic (10N-65N).  No SST modification if sea ice is present.  For groups that are unable to restore SSTs.
ImposeSSTclimNAtlantic.keywords: DCPP, SST, imposed, climatology, north Atlantic
ImposeSSTclimNAtlantic.label: Impose SST clim N Atlantic

piSolarParticleForcing.description: Pre-Industrial solar particle forcing (1850-1873 mean). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
piSolarParticleForcing.keywords: Solar forcing, Pre-Industrial, pi, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
piSolarParticleForcing.label: Pre-Industrial Solar Particle Forcing

165yrs1850-2014.keywords: 1850, 2014, Historical, Recent Past, pre-industrial to present, IPCC
165yrs1850-2014.label: 1850-2014 165yrs

agungAerosol.data_link: Stratospheric Aerosol Data Set (SADS Version 2) Prospectus
agungAerosol.description: Aerosol forcing from the 1963 Agung volcanic eruption.
agungAerosol.label: Agung Aerosol

1960annualx10.description: A multi-ensemble of 600 simulations with ten initialisations for each start date occuring every year from 1960 to the present.
1960annualx10.keywords: ten, 10, initialisations, 1960, annual, start date ensemble
1960annualx10.label: 1960Annualx10

realTimeAnnualxn.description: A multi-ensemble with N initialisations for each start date in real time and ongoing.
realTimeAnnualxn.keywords: ten, 10, initialisations, real-time, annual, start date ensemble
realTimeAnnualxn.label: realTimeAnnualxN

HistoricalSolarParticleForcing.description: Historical solar particle forcing (1850-2014). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
HistoricalSolarParticleForcing.keywords: Solar forcing, Historical, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
HistoricalSolarParticleForcing.label: Historical Solar Particle Forcing

1960biennialx10.description: A multi-ensemble of 300 simulations with ten initialisations for each start date occuring every other year from 1960 to the present.
1960biennialx10.keywords: ten, 10, initialisations, 1960, biennial, start date ensemble
1960biennialx10.label: 1960Biennialx10

RestoreSSTAMVposExTropNAtlantic.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
RestoreSSTAMVposExTropNAtlantic.description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus positive AMV anomaly by Newtonian cooling over the extra-tropical north Atlantic (30N-65N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present. Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.
RestoreSSTAMVposExTropNAtlantic.keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, AMV+, positive AMV, Positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability, extra-tropical north Atlantic
RestoreSSTAMVposExTropNAtlantic.label: Restore SST AMV pos Extra Tropical N Atlantic

ImposeSSTAMVnegNAtlantic.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
ImposeSSTAMVnegNAtlantic.description: Alter surface fluxes to impose model climatology plus negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomalies of Sea Surface Temperature (SST) over the  North Atlantic (10N-65N).  Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.  For groups that are unable to restore SSTs.
ImposeSSTAMVnegNAtlantic.keywords: DCPP, SST, imposed, AMV-, negative AMV, negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability anomaly
ImposeSSTAMVnegNAtlantic.label: Impose SST AMV neg N Atlantic

RestoreSSTAMVnegTropNAtlantic.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
RestoreSSTAMVnegTropNAtlantic.description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus positive AMV anomaly by Newtonian cooling over the tropical north Atlantic (10N-30N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present.  Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.
RestoreSSTAMVnegTropNAtlantic.keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, AMV-, negative AMV, negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability, tropical north Atlantic
RestoreSSTAMVnegTropNAtlantic.label: Restore SST AMV neg tropical N Atlantic

RestoreSSTPDVnegPacific.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
RestoreSSTPDVnegPacific.description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus negative PDV anomaly by Newtonian cooling over the Pacific (10S-65N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present. Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.
RestoreSSTPDVnegPacific.keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, PDV-, negative PDV, negative Pacific Decadal Variability
RestoreSSTPDVnegPacific.label: Restore SST PDV neg Pacific

TenMemberEnsemble.description: An ensemble of at least ten simulations
TenMemberEnsemble.label: TenMember

realTimeAnnualx10.description: A multi-ensemble with ten initialisations for each start date in real time and ongoing.
realTimeAnnualx10.keywords: ten, 10, initialisations, real-time, annual, start date ensemble
realTimeAnnualx10.label: realTimeAnnualx10

InitialRCPForcingMaintained.description: RCP4.5 forcing information (e.g. greenhouse gas concentrations, aerosols etc.) maintained at initial state values, or projected in a simple way. No inclusion of volcano or other short term forcing unless available at initial time.
InitialRCPForcingMaintained.label: Initial RCP45 Forcing Maintained

RestoreSSTAMVnegExTropNAtlantic.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
RestoreSSTAMVnegExTropNAtlantic.description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus positive AMV anomaly by Newtonian cooling over the extra-tropical north Atlantic (30N-65N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present.  Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.
RestoreSSTAMVnegExTropNAtlantic.keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, AMV-, negative AMV, negative Atlantic Multidecadal Variability, extra-tropical north Atlantic
RestoreSSTAMVnegExTropNAtlantic.label: Restore SST AMV neg Extra Tropical N Atlantic

10yrs.description: Run for 10 years, for use with a start date ensemble.
10yrs.label: 10yrs

ImposeSSTAMVposExTropNAtlantic.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
ImposeSSTAMVposExTropNAtlantic.description: Alter surface fluxes to impose model climatology plus positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability (AMV) anomalies of Sea Surface Temperature (SST) over the extra-tropical north Atlantic (30N-65N).  Idealised AMV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.  For groups that are unable to restore SSTs.
ImposeSSTAMVposExTropNAtlantic.keywords: DCPP, SST, imposed, AMV+, positive AMV, positive Atlantic Multidecadal Variability anomaly, extra-tropical north Atlantic
ImposeSSTAMVposExTropNAtlantic.label: Impose SST AMV pos extra tropical N Atlantic

ImposeSSTObsTropEPacific.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
ImposeSSTObsTropEPacific.description: Alter surface fluxes to impose model climatology plus observed historical anomalies of Sea Surface Temperature (SST) over the deep tropical eastern Pacific.  Monthly SST anomalies (1950-2014) will be provided by DCPP.  For groups that are unable to restore SSTs.
ImposeSSTObsTropEPacific.keywords: DCPP, SST, imposed, observations, eastern equatorial Pacific
ImposeSSTObsTropEPacific.label: Impose SST Obs Trop E Pacific

RestoreSSTclimNAtlantic.description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model control run climatology by Newtonian cooling over the North Atlantic (10N-65N). The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present.
RestoreSSTclimNAtlantic.keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, climatology, north Atlantic
RestoreSSTclimNAtlantic.label: Restore SST clim N Atlantic

ImposeSSTPDVposPacific.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
ImposeSSTPDVposPacific.description: Alter surface fluxes to impose model climatology plus positive Pacific Decadal Variability (PDV) anomalies of Sea Surface Temperature (SST) over the  Pacific (15S-65N).    Idealised PDV anomalies of SST will be provided by DCPP.  For groups that are unable to restore SSTs.
ImposeSSTPDVposPacific.keywords: DCPP, SST, imposed, PDV+, positive PDV, positive Pacific Decadal Variability anomaly
ImposeSSTPDVposPacific.label: Impose SST PDV pos Pacific

RestoreSSTrunningMeanNAtlantic.data_link: DCPP prescribed sea surface temperature (SST) patterns: AMV SST data, PDV SST data and Pacemaker SST data.
RestoreSSTrunningMeanNAtlantic.description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus a 12-month running mean of SST anomalies by a Newtonian cooling over the North Atlantic (10N-65N).  The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent). The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  No restoring if sea ice is present.  SST anomalies (1950-2014) will be provided by DCPP.
RestoreSSTrunningMeanNAtlantic.keywords: DCPP, SST, restored, running mean, north Atlantic
RestoreSSTrunningMeanNAtlantic.label: Restore SST running mean N Atlantic

MinimiseAMOCchange.description: Minimise changes to Atlantic Meridional Overturning Circulation (AMOC).  Can be achieved by appying additional salinity restoring such that the upper ocean density remains unchanged. Can also be achieved via 3D restoring of temperature and salinity below the mixed layer.
MinimiseAMOCchange.keywords: DCPP, minimise AMOC change, restore salinity
MinimiseAMOCchange.label: Minimise AMOC change

NAtlanticClimInitialisation.description: Initialise with climatology (1960-2009 average) in the north Atlantic "sub-polar ocean" (95W-30E, 45N-90N).  Linear transition between climatology and actual observations over a 10 deg buffer zone (35N-45N).  Elsewhere inititialisation is based on observations.
NAtlanticClimInitialisation.keywords: North Atlantic, sub-polar gyre, climatology, observation, initialisation
NAtlanticClimInitialisation.label: NAtlanticClimInitialisation

HistoricalInitialisation.description: Initialisation is from the end of the Historical experiment.  To provide continuity between simulations of the recent past and  future scenario simulations.

25memberEnsemble.description: Ensemble members generated by perturbing atmospheric conditions
25memberEnsemble.label: 25Member

FutureSolarParticleForcing.description: Future solar particle forcing (2015-2299). For models with interactive stratospheric chemstiry.  Proton forcing: HOx and NOx production by solar protons. Electron forcing:  Kp- or Ap-index to describe ionisation from electron precipitation in the lower thermosphere and upper mesosphere. Cosmic ray forcing:  ion-pair produciont by galactic gosmic rays.  CMIP6 models that do not have interactive chemistry should  prescribe the CMIP6 recommended ozone forcing data set.
FutureSolarParticleForcing.keywords: Solar forcing, Future, Particle forcing, proton forcing, electron forcing, cosmic ray ionisation
FutureSolarParticleForcing.label: Future Solar Particle Forcing

HistoricalSolarForcing.description: Solar forcing of the Earth system consistent with historical observations.

RestoreSSTObsTropEPacific.description: Sea Surface Temperatures (SSTs) are restored to model climatology plus observed historical anomalies by a Newtonian cooling over the deep tropical eastern Pacific. The restoring timescale is 10 days for a 50m deep mixed layer (or equivalent).  The restoring coefficient of 40 W/m2/K should decrease to zero over an 8 degree buffer zone bounding the restored region.  Monthly SST anomalies (1950-2014) will be provided by DCPP. FutureSolarIrradiance.data_link: SOLARIS-HEPPA Solar Forcing Data for CMIP6
FutureSolarIrradiance.description: The standard solar forcing dataset recommended for usage is the solar reference scenario dataset which includes future solar forcing (2015-2299).  Includes total solar irradiance, F10.7 cm solar radio flux, and spectral solar irradiance for 10-100000 nm range.

Historical greenhouse gas concentrations.description: Here, we provide consolidated data sets of historical atmospheric (volume) mixing ratios of 43 greenhouse gases specifically for the purpose of climate model runs.

SOLARIS-HEPPA Solar Forcing Data for CMI.description: An overview of the CMIP6 solar forcing dataset (irradiance as well as particle-related parameters) and guidelines for their usage.

Land Use Harmonisation (LUH2 v1.0h) land.description: A new set of global gridded land-use forcing datasets are being developed to link historical land-use data and future projections in a standard format required by climate models.
